metadata.title: CVE-2022-39319 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low
metadata.description:
FreeRDP is a free remote desktop protocol library and clients. Affectedversions of FreeRDP are missing input length validation in the `urbdrc`channel. A malicious server can trick a FreeRDP based client to read out ofbound data and send it back to the server. This issue has been addressed inversion 2.9.0 and all users are advised to upgrade. Users unable to upgradeshould not use the `/usb` redirection switch.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-39319` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

freerdp2-shadow-x11 - 2.8.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu1
freerdp2-wayland - 2.8.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu1
freerdp2-x11 - 2.8.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu1
libfreerdp-client2-2 - 2.8.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu1
libfreerdp-server2-2 - 2.8.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu1
libfreerdp-shadow-subsystem2-2 - 2.8.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu1
libfreerdp-shadow2-2 - 2.8.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu1
libfreerdp2-2 - 2.8.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu1
libuwac0-0 - 2.8.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu1
libwinpr-tools2-2 - 2.8.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu1
libwinpr2-2 - 2.8.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu1
winpr-utils - 2.8.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freerdp2 package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.8.1+dfsg1-1ubuntu1').
